byline.contributor: Jeremy B. Merrill, Kitty Bennett and John Corrales contributed reporting.
byline.original: By PATRICK HEALY and MAGGIE HABERMAN

abstract: Analysis of every public utterance by Donald J Trump over course of week reveals high percentage of divisive phrases, harsh words and violent imagery compared with language used by past presidents; Trump has demonstrated strong ability to bond with average Americans over their fears in regard to terrorism, immigrants and economy.
lead_paragraph: An analysis of 95,000 words Mr. Trump said in public in the past week reveals powerful patterns in his speech which, historians say, echo the appeals of demagogues of the past century.

headline.main: 95,000 Words, Many of Them Ominous, From Donald Trump’s Tongue
headline.print_headline: 95,000 Words, Many of Them Ominous, From Trump’s Tongue

snippet: An analysis of 95,000 words Mr. Trump said in public in the past week reveals powerful patterns in his speech which, historians say, echo the appeals of demagogues of the past century.
